annotations.description: What a terrific football game that was, with everything included. The game was more or less balanced. The hosts tried to catch the opposition off guard and hit them on the break. The visiting side kept the ball at their feet and the main intention was to produce that final killer pass.

annotations.description: That's all for today as the game is over.

That didn't go as planned! Pablo Pedro Hernandez (Celta Vigo) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the bottom left corner was too weak to get past Marc Andre ter Stegen, who easily kept it out.
Jeremy Mathieu (Barcelona) commits a rough challenge and Inaki Vicandi Garrido blows his whistle for an infringement.

What an opportunity! Gerard Pique (Barcelona) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the left post!

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: A perfect lofted pass from Denis Suarez finds Gerard Pique (Barcelona), who jumps highest and steers a close range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Sergio Alvarez had no chance of stopping that. 3:2.
Gerard Pique (Barcelona) takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's not a big threat for the goalkeeper as his effort is blocked by a defender.

annotations.label: penalty
annotations.description: Hugo Mallo (Celta Vigo) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: „Treat others as you want to be treated.“ He makes a bad challenge and leaves Inaki Vicandi Garrido with no other option than to blow for a foul. The referee gives a penalty to Barcelona after a quick talk with the linesman, who had apparently seen the situation from a better perspective.

We are watching a run of the mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. The hosts dominated much of the first period. The home team's main weapon is fast counter attacks, while the away side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible.
